data.title: Book summaries, reviews, and critiques dealing with philosophy
data.text:
Philosophy (more or less)

"I truly believe

the book of philosophy

to be that which stands perpetually open

before our eyes,

though since it is written

in characters different

from those of our alphabet

it cannot be read by everyone."

Galileo Galilei from Galileo at Work

Anthem by Ayn Rand

The Ascent of Science by Brian Silver

Atheism, Ayn Rand, and Other Heresies by George Smith

Atlas Shrugged by Ayn Rand

Before The Beginning: Our Universe and Others by Martin Rees

Billions and Billions by Carl Sagan

The Biology of Belief by Joseph Giovannoli

The Book of the Cosmos

Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee by Dee Brown

A Chosen Faith: An Introduction to Unitarian Universalism by John A. Buehrens & Forrest Church

Civilization and Its Enemies: The Next Stage of History by Lee Harris

Creation: Life and How to Make It by Steve Grand lscgid: execve():/home/travelja/public_html/2think.org/2thinkcgi/cover.pl: Permission denied

Darwin's Dangerous Idea : Evolution and the Meanings of Life by Daniel C. Dennett

Darwin and Design: Does Evolution Have a Purpose? by Michael Ruse

Darwin: The Life of a Tormented Evolutionist by Adrian Desmond & James Moore

Desert Solitaire by Edward Abbey

Doubt and Certainty by Tony Rothman & George Sudarshan

Drawing the Line: Science and the Case for Animal Rights by Steven M. Wise

Dropping the God Bomb 2.0 by Teddy Lee Brown

Edge of Tomorrow: An Arctic Year by Sam Wright

Einstein, History, and Other Passions by Gerald Holton

Emerson : The Mind on Fire by Robert D. Richardson

"Let us so grace the world with our lives

that we beg for nothing in return for our deaths."

-- Matt Berry A Human Strategy (p. 158)

Exuberance : A Philosophy of Happiness by Paul Kurtz

For the Common Good by Herman E. Daly & John B. Cobb, Jr.

Foucault's Pendulum by Umberto Eco (fiction)

Galileo at Work: His Scientific Biography by Stillman Drake

Gay Marriage: Why It Is Good for Gays, Good for Straights, and Good for America by Jonathan Rauch

The Greeks and Their Gods by W. K. C. Guthrie

Greek Thought: A Guide to Classical Knowledge

Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Human Societies by Jared Diamond

lscgid: execve():/home/travelja/public_html/2think.org/2thinkcgi/cover.pl: Permission denied A Human Strategy by Matt Berry

Huxley: From Devil's Disciple to Evolution's High Priest by Adrian Desmond

Immortality Paul Edwards (editor)

Influence of Darwin on Philosophy and Other Essays by John Dewey

Information: The New Language of Science by Hans Christian von Baeyer

The Innocents Abroad by Mark Twain

Invariances: The Structure of the Objective World by Robert Nozick

Ishmael by Daniel Quinn

Kinds of Minds by Daniel C. Dennett

Lectures on the History of Moral Philosophy by John Rawls

Life by Richard Fortey

The Life of the Cosmos by Lee Smolin

Matters of Conscience: Conversations With Sterling M. McMurrin by L. Jackson Newell

The Meaning of It All: Thoughts of a Citizen Scientist by Richard Feynman

The Mechanics of Virtue: A Cynic's Guide to Righteous Behavior by Matt Berry

The Metaphysical Club: A Story of Ideas in America by Louis Menand

The Mind's I by Douglas Hofstadter & Daniel C. Dennett

Nothingness: The Science of Empty Space by Henning Genz

Origins Reconsidered : In Search of What Makes Us Human by Richard Leakey

The Other Side of Eden by Hugh Brody

Our Posthuman Future: Consequences of the Biotechnology Revolution by Francis Fukuyama

Pandora's Hope: Essays on the Reality of Science Studies by Bruno Latour

The Population Explosion by Paul Ehrlich

Post-Atheism: A Mechanist's Journey from Christian Materialism to Material Spirituality by Matt Berry

"Criticism of the founder or followers of a philosophy

does not, by itself,

constitute a negation of any part of the philosophy...

Criticism of part of a philosophy

does not gainsay the whole."

Michael Shermer from Why People Believe Weird Things

Raising Lifelong Learners by Lucy Calkins

Ralph Waldo Emerson, Realist: Essays of Resignation and Renewal

Rattling the Cage by Steven M. Wise

Reconstruction in Philosophy by John Dewey

The Roving Mind by Isaac Asimov

Secular Wholeness: A Skeptic's Paths to a Richer Life by David E. Cortesi

Self-Reliance by Ralph Waldo Emerson

The Social Construction of What? by Ian Hacking

The Structure of Scientific Revolutions by Thomas S. Kuhn

Tales of the Rational: Skeptical Essays About Nature and Science by Massimo Pigliucci

A Theory of Everything: An Integral Vision for Business, Politics, Science, and Spirituality by Ken Wilber

Thomas Paine : Apostle of Freedom by Jack Fruchtman

Time and Chance by David Z. Albert

Ultimate Punishment: A Lawyer's Reflections on Dealing with the Death Penalty by Scott Turow

Virus of the Mind: The New Science of the Meme by Richard Brodie
